verses.text: And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w numbered|strong="H6485"\w* the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* that \add were\add* with him, and \w set|strong="H7760"\w* \w captains|strong="H8269"\w* of \w thousands|strong="H0505"\w* and \w captains|strong="H8269"\w* of \w hundreds|strong="H3967"\w* over them.

And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* sent \w forth|strong="H7971"\w* a third \w part|strong="H7992"\w* of the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* under the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, and a third \w part|strong="H7992"\w* under the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of \w Abishai|strong="H0052"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Zeruiah|strong="H6870"\w*, \w Joab’s|strong="H3097"\w* \w brother|strong="H0251"\w*, and a third \w part|strong="H7992"\w* under the \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* of \w Ittai|strong="H0863"\w* the \w Gittite|strong="H1663"\w*. And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*, I will \w surely|strong="H3318"\w* go \w forth|strong="H3318"\w* with you \w myself|strong="H0589"\w* also.

But the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w answered|strong="H0559"\w*, Thou shalt not go \w forth|strong="H3318"\w*: for if we \w flee|strong="H5127"\w* \w away|strong="H5127"\w*, they will not \w care|strong="H7760"\w* for us; neither if \w half|strong="H2677"\w* of us \w die|strong="H4191"\w*, will they \w care|strong="H7760"\w* for us: but now \add thou art\add* \w worth|strong="H3644"\w* \w ten|strong="H6235"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* of us: therefore now \add it is\add* \w better|strong="H2896"\w* that thou \w succour|strong="H5826"\w* us out of the \w city|strong="H5892"\w*.\f + \fr 18.3 \ft care…: Heb. set their heart on us\f*\f + \fr 18.3 \ft worth…: Heb. as ten thousand of us\f*\f + \fr 18.3 \ft succour: Heb. be to succour or help\f*

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto them, What \w seemeth|strong="H5869"\w* you \w best|strong="H3190"\w* I will \w do|strong="H6213"\w*. And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w stood|strong="H5975"\w* by the \w gate|strong="H8179"\w* \w side|strong="H3027"\w*, and all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* came \w out|strong="H3318"\w* by \w hundreds|strong="H3967"\w* and by \w thousands|strong="H0505"\w*.

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w commanded|strong="H6680"\w* \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* and \w Abishai|strong="H0052"\w* and \w Ittai|strong="H0863"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, \add Deal\add* \w gently|strong="H0328"\w* for my sake with the young \w man|strong="H5288"\w*, \add even\add* with \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*. And all the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w heard|strong="H8085"\w* when the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* gave all the \w captains|strong="H8269"\w* \w charge|strong="H6680"\w* \w concerning|strong="H1697"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*.

¶ So the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* went \w out|strong="H3318"\w* into the \w field|strong="H7704"\w* \w against|strong="H7125"\w* \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*: and the \w battle|strong="H4421"\w* was in the \w wood|strong="H3293"\w* of \w Ephraim|strong="H0669"\w*;

Where the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* of \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* were \w slain|strong="H5062"\w* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* the \w servants|strong="H5650"\w* of \w David|strong="H1732"\w*, and there was there a \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w slaughter|strong="H4046"\w* that \w day|strong="H3117"\w* of \w twenty|strong="H6242"\w* \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \add men\add*.

For the \w battle|strong="H4421"\w* was there \w scattered|strong="H6327"\w* over the \w face|strong="H6440"\w* of all the \w country|strong="H0776"\w*: and the \w wood|strong="H3293"\w* \w devoured|strong="H0398"\w* \w more|strong="H7235"\w* \w people|strong="H5971"\w* that \w day|strong="H3117"\w* than the \w sword|strong="H2719"\w* \w devoured|strong="H0398"\w*.\f + \fr 18.8 \ft devoured: Heb. multiplied to devour\f*

¶ And \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w met|strong="H7122"\w* the \w servants|strong="H6440"\w* of \w David|strong="H1732"\w*. And \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w rode|strong="H7392"\w* upon a \w mule|strong="H6505"\w*, and the \w mule|strong="H6505"\w* \w went|strong="H0935"\w* under the thick \w boughs|strong="H7730"\w* of a \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w oak|strong="H0424"\w*, and his \w head|strong="H7218"\w* caught \w hold|strong="H2388"\w* of the \w oak|strong="H0424"\w*, and he was taken \w up|strong="H5414"\w* between the \w heaven|strong="H8064"\w* and the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w*; and the \w mule|strong="H6505"\w* that \add was\add* under him went \w away|strong="H5674"\w*.

And a \w certain|strong="H0259"\w* \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* \add it\add*, and \w told|strong="H5046"\w* \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Behold, I \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w hanged|strong="H8518"\w* in an \w oak|strong="H0424"\w*.

And \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto the \w man|strong="H0376"\w* that \w told|strong="H5046"\w* him, And, behold, thou \w sawest|strong="H7200"\w* \add him\add*, and why didst thou not \w smite|strong="H5221"\w* him there to the \w ground|strong="H0776"\w*? and I would have \w given|strong="H5414"\w* thee \w ten|strong="H6235"\w* \add shekels\add* of \w silver|strong="H3701"\w*, and \w a|strong="H0259"\w* \w girdle|strong="H2290"\w*.

And the \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, \w Though|strong="H3863"\w* I should \w receive|strong="H8254"\w* a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \add shekels\add* of \w silver|strong="H3701"\w* in mine \w hand|strong="H3709"\w*, \add yet\add* would I not put \w forth|strong="H7971"\w* mine \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* against the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w son|strong="H1121"\w*: for in our \w hearing|strong="H0241"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w charged|strong="H6680"\w* thee and \w Abishai|strong="H0052"\w* and \w Ittai|strong="H0863"\w*, \w saying|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Beware|strong="H8104"\w* that none \add touch\add* the young \w man|strong="H5288"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*.\f + \fr 18.12 \ft receive: Heb. weigh upon mine hand\f*\f + \fr 18.12 \ft Beware…: Heb. Beware whosoever ye be of, etc\f*

\w Otherwise|strong="H0176"\w* I should have \w wrought|strong="H6213"\w* \w falsehood|strong="H8267"\w* against mine own \w life|strong="H5315"\w*: for there is no \w matter|strong="H1697"\w* \w hid|strong="H3582"\w* from the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and thou thyself wouldest have \w set|strong="H3320"\w* thyself against \add me\add*.

Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, I may not \w tarry|strong="H3176"\w* thus with \w thee|strong="H6440"\w*. And he \w took|strong="H3947"\w* \w three|strong="H7969"\w* \w darts|strong="H7626"\w* in his \w hand|strong="H3709"\w*, and \w thrust|strong="H8628"\w* them through the \w heart|strong="H3820"\w* of \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*, while he \add was\add* yet \w alive|strong="H2416"\w* in the midst of the \w oak|strong="H0424"\w*.\f + \fr 18.14 \ft with…: Heb. before thee\f*\f + \fr 18.14 \ft midst: Heb. heart\f*

And \w ten|strong="H6235"\w* young \w men|strong="H5288"\w* that \w bare|strong="H5375"\w* \w Joab’s|strong="H3097"\w* \w armour|strong="H3627"\w* compassed \w about|strong="H5437"\w* and \w smote|strong="H5221"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*, and \w slew|strong="H4191"\w* him.

And \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w blew|strong="H8628"\w* the \w trumpet|strong="H7782"\w*, and the \w people|strong="H5971"\w* \w returned|strong="H7725"\w* from \w pursuing|strong="H7291"\w* \w after|strong="H0310"\w* \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w*: for \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* held \w back|strong="H2820"\w* the \w people|strong="H5971"\w*.

And they \w took|strong="H3947"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*, and \w cast|strong="H7993"\w* him into a \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w pit|strong="H6354"\w* in the \w wood|strong="H3293"\w*, and \w laid|strong="H5324"\w* a \w very|strong="H3966"\w* \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w heap|strong="H1530"\w* of \w stones|strong="H0068"\w* upon him: and all \w Israel|strong="H3478"\w* \w fled|strong="H5127"\w* every \w one|strong="H0376"\w* to his \w tent|strong="H0168"\w*.

¶ Now \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* in his \w lifetime|strong="H2416"\w* had \w taken|strong="H3947"\w* and reared \w up|strong="H5324"\w* for himself a \w pillar|strong="H4678"\w*, which \add is\add* in the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w dale|strong="H6010"\w*: for he \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, I have no \w son|strong="H1121"\w* to keep my \w name|strong="H8034"\w* in \w remembrance|strong="H2142"\w*: and he \w called|strong="H7121"\w* the \w pillar|strong="H4678"\w* after his own \w name|strong="H8034"\w*: and it is \w called|strong="H7121"\w* unto this \w day|strong="H3117"\w*, \w Absalom’s|strong="H0053"\w* \w place|strong="H3027"\w*.

¶ Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* \w Ahimaaz|strong="H0290"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Zadok|strong="H6659"\w*, Let me now \w run|strong="H7323"\w*, and \w bear|strong="H1319"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w tidings|strong="H1319"\w*, how that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath \w avenged|strong="H8199"\w* him of his \w enemies|strong="H3027"\w*.\f + \fr 18.19 \ft avenged…: Heb. judged him from the hand, etc\f*

And \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, \w Thou|strong="H0376"\w* shalt not bear \w tidings|strong="H1309"\w* this \w day|strong="H3117"\w*, but thou shalt bear \w tidings|strong="H1319"\w* \w another|strong="H0312"\w* \w day|strong="H3117"\w*: but this \w day|strong="H3117"\w* thou shalt bear no \w tidings|strong="H1319"\w*, because the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w son|strong="H1121"\w* is \w dead|strong="H4191"\w*.\f + \fr 18.20 \ft bear tidings this: Heb. be a man of tidings, etc\f*

Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* to \w Cushi|strong="H3569"\w*, \w Go|strong="H3212"\w* \w tell|strong="H5046"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* what thou hast \w seen|strong="H7200"\w*. And \w Cushi|strong="H3569"\w* \w bowed|strong="H7812"\w* himself unto \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, and \w ran|strong="H7323"\w*.

Then \w said|strong="H0559"\w* \w Ahimaaz|strong="H0290"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Zadok|strong="H6659"\w* yet \w again|strong="H3254"\w* to \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w*, But \w howsoever|strong="H4100"\w*, let me, I pray thee, also \w run|strong="H7323"\w* \w after|strong="H0310"\w* \w Cushi|strong="H3569"\w*. And \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Wherefore wilt thou \w run|strong="H7323"\w*, my \w son|strong="H1121"\w*, seeing that thou hast no \w tidings|strong="H1309"\w* \w ready|strong="H4672"\w*?\f + \fr 18.22 \ft howsoever: Heb. be what may\f*\f + \fr 18.22 \ft ready: or, convenient\f*

But howsoever, \add said he\add*, let me \w run|strong="H7323"\w*. And he \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto him, \w Run|strong="H7323"\w*. Then \w Ahimaaz|strong="H0290"\w* \w ran|strong="H7323"\w* by the \w way|strong="H1870"\w* of the \w plain|strong="H3603"\w*, and \w overran|strong="H5674"\w* \w Cushi|strong="H3569"\w*.

And \w David|strong="H1732"\w* \w sat|strong="H3427"\w* between the \w two|strong="H8147"\w* \w gates|strong="H8179"\w*: and the \w watchman|strong="H6822"\w* went \w up|strong="H3212"\w* to the \w roof|strong="H1406"\w* over the \w gate|strong="H8179"\w* unto the \w wall|strong="H2346"\w*, and lifted \w up|strong="H5375"\w* his \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w*, and \w looked|strong="H7200"\w*, and behold a \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w running|strong="H7323"\w* alone.

And the \w watchman|strong="H6822"\w* \w cried|strong="H7121"\w*, and \w told|strong="H5046"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*. And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, If he \add be\add* alone, \add there is\add* \w tidings|strong="H1309"\w* in his \w mouth|strong="H6310"\w*. And he \w came|strong="H3212"\w* \w apace|strong="H1980"\w*, and drew \w near|strong="H7131"\w*.

And the \w watchman|strong="H6822"\w* \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* \w another|strong="H0312"\w* \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w running|strong="H7323"\w*: and the \w watchman|strong="H6822"\w* \w called|strong="H7121"\w* unto the \w porter|strong="H7778"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Behold \add another\add* \w man|strong="H0376"\w* \w running|strong="H7323"\w* alone. And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, He also bringeth \w tidings|strong="H1319"\w*.

And the \w watchman|strong="H6822"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Me \w thinketh|strong="H7200"\w* the \w running|strong="H4794"\w* of the \w foremost|strong="H7223"\w* is like the \w running|strong="H4794"\w* of \w Ahimaaz|strong="H0290"\w* the \w son|strong="H1121"\w* of \w Zadok|strong="H6659"\w*. And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, He \add is\add* a \w good|strong="H2896"\w* \w man|strong="H0376"\w*, and \w cometh|strong="H0935"\w* with \w good|strong="H2896"\w* \w tidings|strong="H1309"\w*.\f + \fr 18.27 \ft Me…: Heb. I see the running\f*

And \w Ahimaaz|strong="H0290"\w* \w called|strong="H7121"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, All is \w well|strong="H7965"\w*. And he fell \w down|strong="H7812"\w* to the \w earth|strong="H0776"\w* upon his \w face|strong="H0639"\w* before the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Blessed|strong="H1288"\w* \add be\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy \w God|strong="H0430"\w*, which hath delivered \w up|strong="H5462"\w* the \w men|strong="H0582"\w* that lifted \w up|strong="H5375"\w* their \w hand|strong="H3027"\w* against my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*.\f + \fr 18.28 \ft All…: or, Peace be to thee: Heb. Peace\f*\f + \fr 18.28 \ft delivered…: Heb. shut up\f*

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, Is the young \w man|strong="H5288"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w safe|strong="H7965"\w*? And \w Ahimaaz|strong="H0290"\w* \w answered|strong="H0559"\w*, When \w Joab|strong="H3097"\w* \w sent|strong="H7971"\w* the \w king’s|strong="H4428"\w* \w servant|strong="H5650"\w*, and \add me\add* thy \w servant|strong="H5650"\w*, I \w saw|strong="H7200"\w* a \w great|strong="H1419"\w* \w tumult|strong="H1995"\w*, but I \w knew|strong="H3045"\w* not what \add it was\add*.\f + \fr 18.29 \ft Is…: Heb. Is there peace?\f*

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* \add unto him\add*, Turn \w aside|strong="H5437"\w*, \add and\add* \w stand|strong="H3320"\w* \w here|strong="H3541"\w*. And he turned \w aside|strong="H5437"\w*, and stood \w still|strong="H5975"\w*.

And, behold, \w Cushi|strong="H3569"\w* \w came|strong="H0935"\w*; and \w Cushi|strong="H3569"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, \w Tidings|strong="H1319"\w*, my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*: for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath \w avenged|strong="H8199"\w* thee this \w day|strong="H3117"\w* of all \w them|strong="H3027"\w* that rose \w up|strong="H6965"\w* against thee.\f + \fr 18.31 \ft Tidings: Heb. Tidings is brought\f*

And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* \w said|strong="H0559"\w* unto \w Cushi|strong="H3569"\w*, Is the young \w man|strong="H5288"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w* \w safe|strong="H7965"\w*? And \w Cushi|strong="H3569"\w* \w answered|strong="H0559"\w*, The \w enemies|strong="H0341"\w* of my \w lord|strong="H0113"\w* the \w king|strong="H4428"\w*, and all that \w rise|strong="H6965"\w* against thee to do \add thee\add* \w hurt|strong="H7451"\w*, be as \add that\add* young \w man|strong="H5288"\w* \add is\add*.

¶ And the \w king|strong="H4428"\w* was much \w moved|strong="H7264"\w*, and went \w up|strong="H5927"\w* to the \w chamber|strong="H5944"\w* over the \w gate|strong="H8179"\w*, and \w wept|strong="H1058"\w*: and as he \w went|strong="H3212"\w*, thus he \w said|strong="H0559"\w*, O my \w son|strong="H1121"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*, my \w son|strong="H1121"\w*, my \w son|strong="H1121"\w* \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*! would God I had \w died|strong="H4191"\w* for \w thee|strong="H5414"\w*, O \w Absalom|strong="H0053"\w*, my \w son|strong="H1121"\w*, my \w son|strong="H1121"\w*!
